title: The Hall of Fame speech Junior Seau’s daughter couldn’t give will make you cry - Patriots
text:
To millions of NFL fans, Junior Seau was known as one of the most tenacious linebackers to ever play the position. To his daughter, Sydney, he was an off-key singer, a clumsy ukulele player, and the most loving man she knew.
She had planned to say as much in a ten-minute speech during at last night’s Hall of Fame induction ceremony, but was told by the Hall her comments would be limited to a five-minute video clip shown at the ceremony. After a storm of criticism, the Hall said last weekend it would let her speak briefly following the unveiling of her father’s bust.
Her three-minute interview during Saturday night’s ceremony touched on some of what she was planning on saying in her speech, but not all.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Recorded in her hotel room in Canton, Seau’s speech is as much a tribute to her father as it is a reminder not to take time with family for granted, and it’s certainly a tearjerker.
Seau died of a self-inflicted gunshot wound in 2012, two years after his last down as a pro football player. He played 13 years for the Chargers, 4 for the Patriots, and 3 for the Dolphins.
